page.title: 20WESTON SCHOOL ORGANISATION
page.content: WHEN I WAS APPOINTED TO THE SCHOOL 17 YEARS AGO FAMILIES WERE ATTRACTED TO A SMALL VILLAGE INSTITUTION FROM THE FRINGE OF THE PARISH, TRADITIONALLY THE CATCHMENT AREA OF ASTON SCHOOL. A NEW SCHOOL SITE WAS ACQUIRED BUT 'CUTS' PREVENTED BUILDING, IN SPITE OF THE RAPID GROWTH OF THE SCHOOL. AS A MAINTAINED SCHOOL, ASTON WENT INTO THE REBUILDING PROGRAMME AUTOMATICALLY AND FAMILIES HAVE BEEN ATTRACTED FROM WESTON. PARENTAL PREFERENCE HAS ENCOURAGED COMPETITION. WITH POOR ACCOMMODATION WESTON IS HANDICAPPED BUT 3 CHILDREN ARE BROUGHT FROM THULSTON, ATTRACTED BY OUR CURRICULUM PUBLICITY. DAILY SESSION/LESSON PLANNING IS DISPLAYED FOR PARENTS TO SEE AND MY FILE IS CIRCULATED DURING THE HOLIDAY WITH CHILDREN'S NOTEBOOKS MAKING IT POSSIBLE FOR PARENTS TO TRACE BACK WORK TO TEACHERS'PLANNING.
